quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to define a function named hello:
[!raw!]
{0} hello(){1}
  print("Hi!")
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Functions[/h1]

In addition to using pre-defined functions, you can create your own functions by using the [b]def [/b]statement.
Here is an example of a function named [b]my_func[/b]. It takes no arguments, and prints "spam" three times. It is defined, and then called. The statements in the function are executed only when the function is called.[code format="py" codeId="329"][b]def [/b]my_func()[b]:[/b]
   print("spam")
   print("spam")
   print("spam")

my_func()[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [code format="raw" ]>>>
spam
spam
spam
>>>[/code]
[note]The code block within every function starts with a colon (:) and is [b]indented[/b].[/note]
